intro: Asteropeia amblyocarpa var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved starfruit, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits that resemble small, yellow-orange berries. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is typically found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity and of interest to horticulturists and conservationists.
